Documentation.Microsoft Office 365: A suite of cloud-based productivity and collaboration applications that integrates all Microsoft's existing online applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Outlook, and others) into a cloud service.
Documentation.Microsoft OneNote for Business: A digital notebook for capturing, storing, and sharing all kinds of information, optimized for business and team collaboration.
Documentation.Microsoft SharePoint: A web-based collaborative platform that integrates with Microsoft Office, primarily used for document storage and management, and team collaboration.
Documentation.Microsoft Stream: An enterprise video service where people in an organization can upload, view, and share videos securely.
Documentation.Microsoft Visio: A diagramming and vector graphics application that helps in creating complex diagrams like flowcharts, organizational charts, and floor plans.
Project Management.Microsoft Project: A project management software designed to assist project managers in developing plans, assigning resources to tasks, tracking progress, managing budgets, and analyzing workloads.
Project Management.Microsoft Planner: A task management tool that allows users to create, assign, and organize tasks, set due dates, and update statuses, ideal for team collaboration and project planning.
Project Management.Azure DevOps: Provides a range of tools for software development teams to plan work, collaborate on code development, and build and deploy applications.
Project Management.Microsoft Lists: An information tracking app in Microsoft 365 that helps users create, share, and track information and tasks with customizable lists.
Frontend.Microsoft Visual Studio: An integrated development environment (IDE) from Microsoft, used for developing computer programs, as well as websites, web apps, web services, and mobile apps.
Frontend.Microsoft PowerApps: A suite that allows users to build custom business apps that connect to business data stored in the underlying data platform (Microsoft Dataverse) or in various online and on-premises data sources.
Frontend.Visual Studio Code: A free, lightweight, open-source code editor from Microsoft that runs on Windows, Linux, and macOS, supporting debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring.
Frontend.Microsoft FrontPage: A discontinued WYSIWYG HTML editor and website administration tool from Microsoft for the Microsoft Windows line of operating systems.
Backend.Microsoft Azure Functions: A serverless compute service that lets you run event-triggered code without having to explicitly provision or manage infrastructure.
Backend.Microsoft Power Automate: A service that helps to create automated workflows between your favorite apps and services to synchronize files, get notifications, collect data, and more.
Backend.Azure Logic Apps: A cloud service that helps you schedule, automate, and orchestrate tasks, business processes, and workflows when you need to integrate apps, data, systems, and services across enterprises or organizations.
Backend.Windows Communication Foundation: A framework for building service-oriented applications that enables developers to build secure, reliable, transacted solutions that integrate across platforms and interoperate with existing investments.
Database.Microsoft SQL Server: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft, offering a variety of tools for data storage, management, analysis, and business intelligence.
Database.Azure SQL Database: A fully managed cloud database provided as part of Microsoft Azure that offers a scalable, multi-model database service for app developers.
Database.Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics: An analytics service bringing together enterprise data warehousing and Big Data analytics, offering a unified experience to ingest, prepare, manage, and serve data for immediate BI and machine learning needs.
Database.Azure Cosmos DB: A globally distributed, multi-model database service for any scale, designed for high availability, consistency, and low latency, supporting various APIs including SQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, and Gremlin.
Content.Microsoft SharePoint: A web-based collaborative platform that integrates with Microsoft Office, widely used for document management, storage, and team collaboration.
Content.Microsoft Yammer: An enterprise social networking service designed for private communication within organizations or between organizational members and pre-designated groups.
Content.Microsoft Teams: A unified communication and collaboration platform that combines persistent workplace chat, video meetings, file storage, and application integration.
Content.Microsoft Sway: A presentation program and a part of the Microsoft Office family of products, providing interactive web-based reports, presentations, newsletters, and more.
Testing.Microsoft Visual Studio: An integrated development environment (IDE) from Microsoft for developing computer programs, web sites, web apps, web services, and mobile apps in various programming languages.
Testing.Azure Test Plans: A service within Azure DevOps that provides a suite of manual and exploratory testing tools for testing applications and solutions.
Testing.Microsoft Test Manager: A tool that was part of Microsoft Test Professional and was used for managing and executing test cases for software applications. Note: Microsoft Test Manager has been deprecated and its functionalities are now part of Azure Test Plans.
Server.Windows Server: A series of enterprise-class server operating systems designed to share services with multiple users and provide extensive administrative control of data storage, applications, and corporate networks.
Server.Microsoft Azure: Microsoft's cloud computing service, offering a wide range of cloud services including computing, analytics, storage, and networking for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications and services through Microsoft-managed data centers.
Server.Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS): A managed container orchestration service, based on Kubernetes, that simplifies the deployment, management, and operations of Kubernetes clusters in the Azure cloud.
Server.Microsoft Windows Virtual Desktop: A cloud-based desktop and app virtualization service that runs on the cloud, enabling users to access virtual desktops and applications remotely.
Server.Microsoft BizTalk Server: An Inter-Organizational Middleware System that enables companies to automate business processes, through the use of adapters which are tailored to communicate with different software systems used in an enterprise.
Deployment.Azure DevOps: A suite of development tools provided by Microsoft Azure to support software development teams with services for collaboration, reporting, tracking work progress, source control, and building and deploying applications.
Deployment.Azure App Service: A fully managed platform for building, deploying, and scaling web apps with support for multiple languages and frameworks, integrated development tools, and managed connectivity to Azure services.
Deployment.Microsoft Endpoint Manager: A unified management platform that combines services such as Microsoft Intune and Configuration Manager to provide centralized management of all your endpoints, including mobile devices and desktops.
Deployment.Azure Resource Manager: A deployment and management service within Azure that provides a management layer enabling users to create, update, and delete resources in their Azure account, organizing resources and enforcing standards.
Maintenance.Microsoft System Center: A suite of systems management products that offers tools for managing data center resources, private clouds, and IT services, helping to provide a unified management experience across on-premises and cloud environments.
Maintenance.Azure Monitor: A comprehensive solution within Microsoft Azure for collecting, analyzing, and acting on telemetry from cloud and on-premises environments, helping to maximize the performance and availability of applications.
Maintenance.Microsoft Endpoint Manager: A unified management platform that combines services such as Microsoft Intune and Configuration Manager, providing centralized management of all endpoints, including mobile devices, laptops, and desktops.
Maintenance.Windows Admin Center: A lightweight, browser-based application for managing servers, clusters, hyper-converged infrastructure, and Windows 10 PCs, offering a modernized, simplified, integrated, and secure remote management experience.
Security.Microsoft Defender for Endpoint: An enterprise-grade platform to help protect networks and devices against cyber threats, providing preventative protection, post-breach detection, automated investigation, and response capabilities.
Security.Azure Active Directory: A cloud-based identity and access management service from Microsoft, providing a range of capabilities including single sign-on, multi-factor authentication, and application management.
Security.Microsoft Cloud App Security: A Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) that provides visibility and control over data and apps in the cloud, enabling advanced threat protection and data security across Microsoft and third-party cloud services.
Security.Azure Sentinel: A scalable, cloud-native Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) and Security Orchestration Automated Response (SOAR) solution that delivers intelligent security analytics and threat intelligence across an enterprise.
Security.Microsoft Identity Manager: An identity management solution that helps manage the users, credentials, policies, and access within an organization, facilitating secure identity management and synchronization.
Automation.Microsoft Power Automate: A service that helps to create automated workflows between your favorite apps and services to synchronize files, get notifications, collect data, and more, enhancing productivity by automating repetitive tasks.
Automation.Azure Logic Apps: A cloud service that helps you schedule, automate, and orchestrate tasks, business processes, and workflows when you need to integrate apps, data, systems, and services across enterprises or organizations.
Automation.Microsoft Azure Automation: A cloud-based automation service that helps with the deployment, configuration, and management of resources in Azure and across external systems, providing automation of frequent, time-consuming, and error-prone cloud management tasks.
Automation.Azure Automation: A service within Microsoft Azure that provides automation capabilities for managing cloud and on-premises environments, offering tools for automating complex and repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and reliability.
Sales.Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Sales: An adaptive selling solution that helps sales teams navigate the realities of modern selling, providing insights to drive personalized engagement and proactive decision-making.
Sales.LinkedIn Sales Navigator: A sales management tool designed to help sales professionals build and nurture customer relationships on the LinkedIn platform, offering advanced search capabilities and personalized algorithms to reach the right decision makers.
Sales.Microsoft Dynamics CRM: An earlier version of Microsoft's customer relationship management software, designed to help businesses manage customer data, streamline processes, and improve customer relationships, now evolved into Dynamics 365.
Marketing.Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing: An integrated marketing tool within the Dynamics 365 suite that helps organizations create and track campaigns, nurture leads, and drive sales through personalized customer experiences and insights.
Marketing.LinkedIn Marketing Solutions: A platform offering a range of tools for marketers to target, reach, and engage with audiences on LinkedIn through various forms of advertising and content marketing strategies.
Marketing.Microsoft Advertising: Formerly known as Bing Ads, this is a service that provides pay-per-click advertising on both the Bing and Yahoo! search engines, helping businesses reach a wide audience and drive traffic to their websites.
Backup.Azure Backup: A cloud-based backup solution that provides simple, secure, and cost-effective solutions to back up your data and recover it from the Microsoft Azure cloud.
Backup.Microsoft System Center Data Protection: A part of the Microsoft System Center suite, it provides continuous data protection and data recovery management for Windows servers and clients.
Backup.Azure Site Recovery: A disaster recovery service that keeps business apps and workloads running during outages by orchestrating replication, failover, and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.
API.Azure API Management: A turnkey solution for publishing APIs to external and internal customers, providing secure and scalable access, with tools to manage, monitor, and analyze the APIs.
API.Microsoft Power Automate (for API-based: Part of the Power Automate service, this feature allows for the creation of automated workflows that integrate with various APIs to connect different services and applications.
API.Microsoft Graph: A developer platform that connects multiple services and devices through a unified API endpoint, enabling access to data, intelligence, and insights coming from the Microsoft Cloud.
Apps.Microsoft AppSource: A marketplace for business users to find and try line-of-business SaaS apps from Microsoft and its partners, tailored to enhance and extend the functionality of Microsoft's existing business solutions.
Apps.Microsoft Teams Apps: A collection of apps and services integrated within Microsoft Teams, enhancing productivity and collaboration by bringing additional functionalities like project management, analytics, and more directly into the Teams environment.
Apps.Windows Store for Business: A version of the Microsoft Store that is specifically tailored for enterprise environments, allowing organizations to find, acquire, manage, and distribute apps to Windows 10 devices across their workforce.
Service Provider Company.Microsoft Consulting Services: A professional service offering from Microsoft that provides strategic guidance and technology expertise to help organizations achieve their business goals and digital transformation objectives.
Service Provider Company.Microsoft Partner Network: A global program designed to support businesses that want to provide services or build solutions on Microsoft platforms, offering access to resources, training, and support to ensure their success.
Service Provider Company.Azure Managed Services: A range of services provided by Microsoft or third-party service providers that help businesses manage and optimize their Azure-based applications and infrastructure, including tasks like monitoring, maintenance, and security.
Individual Service Provider.Microsoft Certified Professionals: Individuals who have completed the professional certification process by Microsoft, demonstrating their expertise and proficiency in various Microsoft technologies and solutions.
Individual Service Provider.Microsoft Certified Trainers: Professionally certified instructors who are qualified to deliver training on Microsoft technologies, often involved in guiding other professionals through Microsoft certification programs.
Individual Service Provider.Microsoft Certified Solution Developer: A certification for developers that validates their ability to design and build solutions using Microsoft's core technologies, including cloud and web-based solutions.
Certifications.Microsoft Certification Programs: A comprehensive range of certification programs offered by Microsoft to validate the skills and expertise of professionals in various Microsoft technologies and job roles.
Certifications.Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Arc: A certification for individuals who have advanced skills and knowledge in designing and implementing solutions on Microsoft Azure, including aspects like computing, network, storage, and security.
Certifications.Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Fundam: An entry-level certification that demonstrates an understanding of Microsoft Dynamics 365 technology and its applications in business processes.
Certifications.Microsoft Certified: Security, Complianc: A certification that validates the foundational knowledge in security, compliance, and identity management across cloud-based and related Microsoft services.
AI.Azure AI Platform: A comprehensive suite of AI services and cognitive APIs provided by Microsoft Azure to build and deploy AI applications and solutions.
AI.Azure Machine Learning: A cloud-based platform designed for developing, training, and deploying machine learning models, offering tools for all skill levels and seamless integration with other Azure services.
AI.Azure Cognitive Services: A collection of AI services and cognitive APIs that enable apps to see, hear, speak, understand, and even begin to reason, intended to make AI accessible to every developer without requiring machine-learning expertise.
AI.Microsoft Power Virtual Agents: A platform that allows users to create powerful chatbots using a guided, no-code graphical interface, integrated with Microsoft's Power Platform.
AI.Microsoft AI Builder: A feature of the Power Platform that brings AI capabilities to apps and workflows, enabling users to easily add intelligence to their applications with pre-built or custom models.
AI.Azure Bot Service: A managed bot development service that helps in building, connecting, deploying, and managing intelligent bots to interact naturally with users on websites, apps, Cortana, Microsoft Teams, Skype, Slack, and more.
Storage.Microsoft OneDrive for Business: A cloud storage service from Microsoft designed for business use, offering secure file sharing, storage, and collaboration as part of the Office 365 suite.
Storage.Azure Storage Solutions: A set of massively scalable and secure cloud storage services from Microsoft Azure, catering to diverse data storage needs, including blob, file, queue, and table storage.
Storage.Azure Blob Storage: A scalable object storage solution for the cloud by Microsoft Azure, designed to store large amounts of unstructured data, such as text or binary data, accessible anywhere via HTTP or HTTPS.
Storage.Azure File Storage: A fully managed file share service in the cloud, part of Microsoft Azure, offering shared file storage via the standard Server Message Block (SMB) protocol.
Storage.Microsoft StorSimple: An integrated storage solution that manages storage tasks between on-premises devices and Azure cloud storage, designed to reduce costs and improve data protection and efficiency.
Operating System.Windows 10: An operating system from Microsoft with a strong focus on user experience and productivity, offering features like a revamped Start menu, virtual desktops, and universal apps.
Operating System.Windows 11: The latest version of Microsoft's operating system, featuring a redesigned interface, improved performance, and new productivity and social features, emphasizing a more streamlined and modern user experience.
Operating System.Windows Server: A series of enterprise-class server operating systems designed to share services with multiple users and provide extensive administrative control of data storage, applications, and corporate networks.
Operating System.Microsoft Windows Embedded: A family of operating systems from Microsoft designed for use in embedded systems, aimed at specific tools and devices like ATMs, POS terminals, and other industrial equipment.
Operating System.Microsoft Hyper-V: A virtualization technology from Microsoft, included in Windows Server, that allows users to create and manage virtual machines to run multiple operating systems side-by-side.
Devices.Microsoft Surface Line of Products: A series of touchscreen-based personal computing devices designed and produced by Microsoft, including laptops, tablets, and interactive whiteboards, known for their high build quality and innovative designs.
Devices.Microsoft HoloLens: An augmented reality (AR) headset developed by Microsoft, featuring holographic lenses for mixed reality experiences, used in various industries for immersive training, visualization, and collaboration.
Devices.Xbox Series X and Series S: The latest generation of gaming consoles from Microsoft, offering high-performance gaming, fast load times, and backward compatibility with a vast Xbox game library. The Series X is the more powerful version, while the Series S is a more affordable, digital-only option.
Devices.Microsoft Mouse and Keyboard Hardware: A range of ergonomic and stylish input devices designed by Microsoft, including mice and keyboards, known for their quality, comfort, and advanced features.
Devices.Microsoft Band: A smart band with fitness tracking and smartwatch capabilities developed by Microsoft, featuring heart rate monitoring, GPS, and integration with various health and fitness apps. (Note: The Microsoft Band was discontinued.)

Domain.Azure Active Directory: A cloud-based identity and access management service.
Domain.Microsoft DNS: Domain Name System services as part of Windows Server.
Domain.Azure Domain Services: Provides managed domain services like domain join, group policy, LDAP, Kerberos/NTLM authentication.

Performance.Azure Monitor: Comprehensive solutions for collecting, analyzing, and acting on telemetry from cloud and on-premises environments.
Performance.System Center Operations Manager: Monitors the health and performance of server infrastructure.
Performance.Windows Performance Monitor: A tool that measures the performance of a Windows system.
Performance.Azure Application Insights: An extensible Application Performance Management (APM) service for web developers.

Communication.Microsoft Teams: An all-in-one communication platform integrating chat, voice, and video conferencing.
Communication.Outlook: Primarily for email communications, includes calendar and task management.
Communication.Skype for Business: Integrated into Microsoft Teams for audio and video calls, chat, and conferencing.
Communication.Yammer: An enterprise social networking service for private communication within organizations.
Communication.Microsoft Exchange Online: A hosted messaging application providing email services.
Communication.Microsoft SharePoint: Facilitates collaboration with document sharing, integrated into communication strategies.
